title: Digital Hardware Engineer
summary: Do you have a passion for taking on big challenges? Do you love pushing the limits of what’s considered feasible? As part of our Wireless Hardware group, you’ll be responsible for bringing groundbreaking wireless connectivity to the world.
description:
-Bring-up and characterize (performance and power) radio chipsets.
-Design and execute system-level test plans for cutting-edge silicon, ensuring peak performance.
-Debug silicon issues and troubleshoot next-generation Apple products.
-Collaborate across the board and with external vendors to uncover the root cause of any silicon design issues that pop up during development.
-Work hand-in-hand with external chipset vendors to develop integration and verification plans.

This role may involve some international travel.
preferred_qualifications:
Hands on Hardware debugging expertise, including the use of modern lab equipment(DSOs, Logic Analyzers, Protocol Analyzers), and prior experience in PCIe PHY validation and protocol analyzer is highly advantageous.
Proficiency in developing tests to target specific aspects of silicon designs and digital Interfaces.
Good understanding of modern operating systems, firmware, and device drivers, with expertise in creating basic software routines and test scripts (eg. Lua, Python, C)
Strong communication skills, coupled with a proactive attitude, for effectively presenting technical information and addressing hardware issues in a team-based environment.
education_experience:
BS and 3+ years of relevant industry experience
3+ years industry experience required with solid understanding of SoC/PMU design and micro-architecture
Experience with high-speed memory systems and Digital communication interfaces (eg. PCIe, RFFE, SPMI, DDR, USB, SPI, I2C)
Familiarity with interpreting and navigating Complex schematics and PCB layouts
